questions.text: All of the following are true about cochlear implant surgery except

options.label: A
options.text: The cochlear implant electrode stimulates the cochlear nerve endings

options.label: B
options.text: The multicannel implant gives better outcome for the patient

options.label: C
options.text: 8th nerve integrity is essential for the cochlear implant successful outcome.

options.label: D
options.text: The implant electrode is placed through Oval window .

questions.correct_answer: D. The implant electrode is placed through Oval window .

questions.text: All of the following are true about bone anchored hearing aid except

options.label: A
options.text: It has surgically implantable titanium fixture

options.label: B
options.text: it transmits sound directly to cochlea through the bone conduction using the principle of osseointegration

options.label: C
options.text: It is indicated in patients with External Auditory canal atresia

options.label: D
options.text: It is not indicated in patients with chronic discharging ear with hearing loss

questions.correct_answer: D. It is not indicated in patients with chronic discharging ear with hearing loss

questions.text: A congenitally profoundly deaf child on radiological evaluation of cochlea and brain with MRI/CT scan has been found to having Mondini’s Dysplasia of cochlea with presence of normal eighth nerve on both sides. He has shown no benefit with 6 months of hearing aid use. What is the best method of hearing rehabilitation in this case
Not a true match about the anatomical aspects of ear

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Subiculum is a bony spicule which separates oval and round windows

options.label: C
options.text: Processus Cochleariformis indicates the basal turn of cochlea.

options.label: D
options.text: Pyramid lies on the posterior wall of middle ear

questions.correct_answer: C. Processus Cochleariformis indicates the basal turn of cochlea.

questions.correct_answer: B. Continue with steroids and repeat assesment

options.text: Otoconia most commonly migrate to Posterior semicircular canal to cause this entity

For last 3 days patient has developed fever with chills, headache and pallor and oedema over mastoid region. The most probable diagnosis is

options.label: C

False regarding Bell’s palsy

questions.text: Patient has the complaint of right sided hearing loss and left ear hearing is normal. Tuning fork tests show that Rinne is Negative on right side and positive on left side. options.label: B

questions.text: All of the following are true about temporal bone fractures except

options.label: B

questions.text: One of the following is not the criteria to label a hearing loss as Sudden SNHL

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about Eustachian tube?

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.correct_answer: B. Its angled at 45 degrees with horizontal at birth

questions.text: Keratosis obturans is caused due to

options.label: B
options.text: Abnormal collection of cerumen in the deeper part of external auditory canal

options.label: C

options.label: C

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about physiology of nose

options.label: B
options.text: Sinuses are mainly ventilated during inspiratory phase of respiration

questions.correct_answer: B. Sinuses are mainly ventilated during inspiratory phase of respiration
